definition: to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
variant of 糊裡糊塗|糊里糊涂[hu2 li5 hu2 tu2]

pinyin: fang4 zhe5 ming2 bai5 zhuang1 hu2 tu5

definition: even the wisest can have a momentary lapse in judgment (idiom)/every man has a fool in his sleeve
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2

sentences.english: Merely continue being the good guy that you probably are.
sentences.chinese: 繼續裝糊塗，做個老好人吧。

sentences.english: This adage says that even a clever person may do something stupidly.
sentences.chinese: 是說聰明人也有一時糊塗做錯事的時候。

sentences.english: I always said she was an awful fool.
sentences.chinese: 我一直就說她是十足的糊塗蟲。

sentences.english: Now here I go gettin' lost in the system.
sentences.chinese: 現在我進了局子，法律體制把我搞糊塗了。

sentences.english: In my opinion, you are muddleheaded enough.
His dotage simply made him more sadistic.
sentences.chinese: 再加上年老糊塗，他就更是個虐待狂了。

sentences.english: Confused ghosts do not know what they are pious, they asked his sister.
sentences.chinese: 糊塗鬼不知道貌岸然它們在幹什麼，就問他姐姐。

sentences.english: I would rather be 'silly' for a few seconds than be 'ignorant' for years.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願糊塗一時也不要愚昧一世。

sentences.english: Hungarian-language schools teach Slovak remarkably badly.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利語學校教的斯洛伐克語一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: China's leaders can be forgiven for a bit of confusion.
sentences.chinese: 中國領導人說話讓人有點糊塗是可以原諒的。

sentences.english: Now I know I have been a fool.
sentences.chinese: 現在我明白了我是一個糊塗人。

sentences.english: Otherwise the little helpers might get your wish muddled up.
sentences.chinese: 不然，小助手們可能就糊里糊塗把你聖誕願望搞錯了。
現在我們真的被搞糊塗了。

definition: to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
